text: Making the Cookies Beat together the butter, sugars, flavoring and eggs. Beat until the mixture becomes creamy. In another bowl, sift together the dry ingredients. Add the dry ingredients to the butter mixture and stir together. The dough will be slightly soft. Add in the chocolate chips and bacon bits. Stir until these additions are well integrated. Place the dough on a sheet of waxed paper and refrigerate for at least an hour or until firm (the time needed may vary).  Preheat the oven to 350ºF/180ºC  Remove the dough from the refrigerator. Pinch off 1 1/2 inch (3.8cm) pieces of dough and roll these into balls. Set the dough balls about 2 inches (5cm) apart on an ungreased cookie sheet. Flatten the dough balls slightly by placing your fingers in the center of them. Bake the cookies for about 10-12 minutes, or until the dough starts to turn golden brown. Allow the cookies to cool on a cooling rack. Making the Maple Cinnamon Glaze Mix all of the ingredients together until smooth and creamy. If lumpy, use a whisk to remove the lumps. Spread or drizzle a small amount of the glaze on the top of each cookie. Allow to set briefly and then the cookies are ready to serve.
